website_summaries.verdict: Versatile binoculars that give you crisp images of the stars as well as objects closer to home.
pros: Rubber coated for protection and comfort
Option to use with a tripod
Compact and fit comfortably in your hand
cons: These binoculars may be too expensive for some people

customer_reviews.title: Incredible buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these, and I am blown away by the optical quality! Have used multiple binoculars thru out a lifetime of birding,from top of the line (Swaros, Zeiss, etc.), to the inexpensive. And I must say these focus lightening fast and the clarity is outstanding! Ergonomically they are easy to handle and quite smaller than I expected for a pair of 12x50 binoculars. Which is a bonus as I get older. These are a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Art R.

customer_reviews.title: Soft at the edges, poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I find there is a distinct sweet spot in the view and around that it gets very soft. Glare handling is ok for this price-point. The focuser is soft and sloppy, with noticeable wiggle when reversing directions. It sometimes takes a bit of twiddling to get the focus you want. I am going to return them and try the Opticron Discovery 7x42. About the same price, and I've heard it's a high quality build but I have not personally tried it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Marc SantaCruz

customer_reviews.title: I love these binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of inexpensive, small, binoculars. The quality of the optics is like night and day. I have used them for both terrestrial and astronomical viewing and the views are clear and bright. The only drawback is they are bigger and heavier and therefore less portable (take up a lot more space in a backpack) than my other binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost. Very happy with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I own a Steiner 8x30 but wanted something more powerful. This fills the bill. Very good quality optics. Sharp and clear with no fish bowling.
customer_reviews.author: Perrier

customer_reviews.title: I haven't tested them much but the glass seems good, the front rubber pieces system seems hokey
customer_reviews.text: 12x50 HD binoculars are a tough price point. I bought these for $250 refurbished. I haven't tested them much but the glass seems good, the front rubber pieces system seems hokey, with them plugging into rubber piece built into armor of shell and definitely won't stay on unless you superglue them. At the price-point I paid I would give a thumbs up, but at full retail I would also check out a few other brands on the 12x50 hd binocular market.before purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great but for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to purchase a 10 x 50 binocular but didn't want to break the bank. I was at a bird festival where there where many vendors including Zeiss, Swarovski and Leica. I looked through everyone and couldn't believe how competitive these where at literally a fraction of the cost as most others, plus a life time warranty! Clarity brightness and great FOV for the magnification. I took them out into the field to a sea watch and was blown away! Check these out if you want a quality binocular for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyJeff

customer_reviews.title: NIKON at half price are better
customer_reviews.text: NIKON at half price are better VALUE. These Celestron are Good enough optics but there quality does not compare to other Brands that are true Optics Manufactures like Nikon, Burris, Leopold and cost about the same or less than these Binoculars. The front lens covers are useless and not only do not stay on the optic but also come out of there buckle with the slightest movement. I expect these are eventually going to get lost. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: 7x33 and 9x33- 5 Star Bins for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just got the 7x33 model and have owned and used the 9x33 model for a couple of years now. My reviews take price into account and for the current price both versions are 5 star all the way. Excellent optical performance in all respects. Neither of mine have much if any drop off in clarity around the edge. FOV in the 7 is wonderful. Ergonomics and overall handling are great for me. The accessories are very nice and functional, especially the harness. I own and regularly use Swarovski, Leica ,Zeiss and Nikon EDG as well as bins costing less than $100. These Celestrons are great performers and a best buy at current pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Mike

customer_reviews.title: Learning
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything about them. Felt very sturdy and sold. I must say that as a new student to binoculars I really think there seems to be little difference in the vision as the price goes up. Interesting .
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought them sooner
customer_reviews.text: The optics are clear at the full focal range, the focus knob is quick and easy while allowing good fine tuning. The amount of light these gather makes such a big difference over our smaller binocs in hazy, misty, low light conditions that these are the go to binocs in those conditions because of how much more can be seen and/or discerned. They are surprisingly good for use at night. After using them for several months, my only regret is not having gotten them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fahle

customer_reviews.title: Not really good binocular
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a try due to some good reviews but I was disappointed because the image was off center and the weight was a bit heavy. Also it's not really comfortable to hold this for long period of time. Wish I try another model instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these are amazing and a great deal
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how much I was missing! These binoculars are super clear, easy to hold, very ergonomic, and clarity adjustment is super easy. I use mine primarily for bird watching and I cannot believe how much I was missing with my old binoculars. They are also tripod mountable too, if you are looking at something for any length of time. These are a real steal at this price, buy them, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As far as functionality and size I am very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: As far as functionality and size I am very happy with these. Store well in the truck and work well in various lighting. the one star missing is for the lens cap that went missing the first time out. The caps are hinged but the ability to pop them out probably made the one come loose when I brushed something. I just removed the other and am getting along just fine. Good glasses, definitely keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Qwkzotc

customer_reviews.title: Nice binoculars, poor lens caps.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have had with this product is that the 50 mm objective lens caps, which appear to be designed to remain attached to the binoculars during use, do NOT remain attached during use. The connection of the cap to the binoculars is very cutsey but very poorly designed and completely ineffective. They fell off the only two times that I used the binoculars and were lost on the second day out!!! When I contacted Celestron for replacements I learned that two replacement rubber lens caps would cost me $30 plus $11 for shipping. The total cost of the binoculars, (which I love), including the poorly designed lens caps (which I hate), was $320 (including shipping).
customer_reviews.author: Larry Cottone

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: View is crystal clear and optics let in a lot of light - I took these on safari and they were perfect! Definitely worth spending the extra money for a better product. Adjusting these to get a clear vision was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clarity. It has other characteristics better than cheaper ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome clarity. It has other characteristics better than cheaper binoculars but it is the clarity I notice most. The 2nd characteristic is that what is in focus is a larger area (like plus or minus a few feet from the object). The only negative is that after a short while they feel heavy to my arms and I need to put them down (but I am a wimp). The other negative is I like binoculars with eyecups and these do not.
customer_reviews.author: Angus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for an Alaskan Cruise. They were superb! They did not fog up. Their distance was great, and they were lightweight enough that I didn't get tired of wearing them. I would say that next to our camera, this was the best thing we took with us on the cruise.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful pair of compact binoculars
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful pair of compact binoculars. They are very clear and bright and easy to hold. The quality is at a very high level for the price.
customer_reviews.author: alberto

customer_reviews.title: Our safari guide was impressed
customer_reviews.text: These binocs were a bit larger and heavier than I expected, but the performance was outstanding. Even our safari guide borrowed them at every opportunity and was impressed. Easy focus and no distortion through the field of view. After a few days we realized we preferred just watching animals through the binoculars rather than taking photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Brugmansia

customer_reviews.title: ... weeks of use while reattaching them dozens of times Better glass for evening and day break then 3 different ...
customer_reviews.text: Brighter than anything under 500 Cheap lens covers lost both in a couple weeks of use while reattaching them dozens of times Better glass for evening and day break then 3 different pairs of German glass I have, one pair is the newest HD glass. These are Made in China and they are worth the money just for the glass It is so good and the price so reasonable I still had to give 5 stars with the lense covers all being crappy😬
customer_reviews.author: Jet cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily for birdwatching purposes. I found this model was one of those often tested and reviewed in several professional ratings of birding binoculars and well rated among the mid-priced brands / models. Since binoculars tend to be heavy around the neck, the lightweight magnesium body was an appreciated feature. The imaging is crisp, and the focusing easy to adjust, as well as the eye relief being sufficient for eyeglass wearers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Very good Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used them on a trip to Boston and they were wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: George W Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Lightweight and compact
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Lightweight and compact. Used these on an African Safari. The size and weight made them easy to keep handy. Optics are very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure they are for hunting
customer_reviews.text: I bought these two years ago for my go to hunting binoculars to use for coues deer and elk in Arizona. The glass is clear but within months one of the eyecups got loose. I've lost and found the objective lens covers too many times to count. They will not stay attached to the binoculars. I hunt hard that is for sure but I paid a fair amount money off of very positive reviews for binoculars that I'm just not seeing the quality out of yet. I would have gone Vortex if I could do it all again.
customer_reviews.author: m1henry

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity
customer_reviews.text: Great binoculars! Viewing images were crystal clear. Every time I use them I marvel at how good they are. One problem is the caps can come off easily if you’re not paying attention. However, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EastAuroraGuy

customer_reviews.title: The binoculars were great for my safari trip
customer_reviews.text: The binoculars were great for my safari trip. I used them to take photos with my I phone 7 with great results. The only issue was the eye frame zoom to take from eye glass wear to no eyeglasses was broken when I first tried to use them. No problem amazin replaced them. I would highly recommend these binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously ordered the vortex diamondback 10x50s, but the interpupillary distance was too far for me. I looked further and found these; they were everything I wanted plus the IPD was smaller! I absolutely love these, the picture is bright and crisp. I like them even better than the diamondbacks. The only drawback is the objective lens covers fall off pretty easily, and I needed them for field work so that is difficult, but that is really a minor thing. Overall an amazing binoc!
customer_reviews.author: Panther

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity, field of view and convience.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both have a pair of these for birdwatching. We both love them as they are excellent binoculars. The clarity and wide field of view are remarkable. The back caps are easy to remove and the front caps stay attached but drop down. You don't have to find someplace to store either set of caps.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H.

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: This one is superb! Extreme resolution, mechanically superb. Excellent low light ability. A very powerful set of binoculars. Great service
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Star gazing amateur
customer_reviews.text: Good Stargazing binoculars. Not too large. Well made. Have been able to pick out Pegasus, Andromeda, M31 - nice moon viewing during crescent Moon. Full Moon is almost to bright to view. Nice to use for bird viewing and taking along with on 4X4 trips. I hope to pick up one of the Celestron Telescopes some day. These binoculars were purchased to see how I like the quality of Celestron and to start amateur star gazing. So far No Complaints. Has a decent carry case. The front covers are attached to the lower part of the objective lens, which would be my only complaint, as the can come off if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Wade C.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so nice.
customer_reviews.text: I've yet to take these in the field, but they seem like a wonderful set of binoculars. Solid, comfortable in the hands, and well-sealed against dust. They come with a nice case and various straps. I'm looking forward to wildlife watching in Africa with these when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barbian

customer_reviews.title: Celestron Granite rocks, it's well made and woth it!
customer_reviews.text: This Celestron Granite binocular is fantastic! I got the 10x42 and it's awesome, crystal clear, excellent light transmission, nice and fast focusing, very High quality, , and light weight too. It's great for sports , hunting, nature and animal watching.
customer_reviews.author: Faziarabi

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for cruise and birding
customer_reviews.text: Great binoculars. Didn't realize what this additional detail would do for the realism of the viewed objects! Cheers! And, quick great delivery of our desired product. Super!
customer_reviews.author: Decatur Guy

customer_reviews.title: Jaw Dropping HD. Best Binoculars ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Best Binoculars Ever Used. Having only used a handful take that comment as you will. Crystal quality. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Joseph Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome safari binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I took these binoculars on a recent safari to Tanzania. The optics were great. They were small and light enough to pack and carry easily. The accompanying harness made it easy to have them readily available for quick viewing. They will be wonderful for birdwatching at home also. Another member of the safari plans to purchase a pair after using mine. They are a gray multi-use binocular.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Meilahn

customer_reviews.title: Great viewing experience
customer_reviews.text: I've hardly begun to put this binocular through its paces, and I love it already. Look forward to enjoying its features for many years.
customer_reviews.author: George Beddingfield

customer_reviews.title: Finding information about the product that assisted me in purchasing the right one.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the weight and eat handling. I bought the binoculars for watching cricket and I am pleased with this product. I received the product is good time and am pleased with the service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best birding binoculars available at this price
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant image quality, even in low light. Strong construction and close focussing also. Hard to find a fault with these optics, and I have used many other binoculars in the past.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding
customer_reviews.text: I can finally ID all the cute little birdies fluttering around my house. ED glass results in sharp magnified images. Only concern is losing the front lense caps; the tabs seem to come off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Mikey Matt

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the quality and performance of these binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality and performance of these binoculars. The Granite series provides light weight clarity as well as durability in the field. I highly recommend these Granite 10x50 binoculars which I have found to be equal to or better than the Vanguard Endeavor ED binoculars that I have used for a somewhat longer period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at how good the optical quality and build quality are for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. WALLACE

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Quality is exceptional. The clarity an distance is better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: T Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Best backyard glass
customer_reviews.text: Wide field, close focus, optically excellent. Great for back yard viewing if you have wildlife visiting.
customer_reviews.author: surfcity

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with my purchase. I own several pairs of binoculars, but have gotten frustrated with lack of clarity and detail, so I bumped up this purchase to another level, with the excuse of being my birthday present. I also checked with Cornell Labs Birds reports on various suggestions. This was the mid-price suggestion one year. I am glad I did my research first. When I first pointed them at something I wanted to see, I think my comment, out loud, was Wow. Color is good, detail is there, it is very easy to focus. Very pleased. Lois Benson
customer_reviews.author: Lois Benson

customer_reviews.title: great product for price
customer_reviews.text: good size, light weight, comparable to other much more expensive binos I have owned. will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: palab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great value. (They would be heavy for regular outdoor use.)
customer_reviews.author: S. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Nice Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Very good binoculars, clear, compact, lightweight, and robust. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott478

customer_reviews.title: Very good. A nice in between size set of binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Very good. A nice in between size set of binoculars. High Quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Collier

customer_reviews.title: The Celestron 71370 8x42 Granite Binoculars are excellent for birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: The Celestron 71370 8x42 Granite Binoculars are excellent for birdwatching. They are very sharp and not too heavy. I am very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Linnet

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using these for viewing birds and wildlife over a year and has been consistently delighted with the crisp views.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are amazing. Glad I went with the granite series as it's definitely worth the extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: chinnman

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent! Great clarity and no noticeable color fringing
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent! Great clarity and no noticeable color fringing. I ordered a few different sets in this price range and these seemed to blow the others away optically.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Fassett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Compact, well made, will be taking them to our Yellowstone park trip next month.
customer_reviews.author: jl

customer_reviews.title: this is so nice. Got it as a gift for my friend
customer_reviews.text: wow, this is so nice. Got it as a gift for my friend. This is so powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Kieve Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Definite "Wow"
customer_reviews.text: Every person who has looked through my Celestron 8x42 Granites said, "wow!"
customer_reviews.author: MJ Manzi

customer_reviews.title: Lens caps
customer_reviews.text: This binoculars are OK. I like my 10x50 Diamondback better. ED or not they are clearer. Had to replace objective lens covers several times before I cut up and old inner tube and used the band to keep them form becoming disconnected
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Safari binocular
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent safari binocular! Lightweight, quick to deploy with excellent optics in all light conditions, this was a great tool to have in the bag over two weeks safari in the Serengeti.
customer_reviews.author: JD Young

customer_reviews.title: Great birding binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I think the Celestron Granite Binoculars are terrific. They provide great clarity, are easily focused and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have made in a long time. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret K. Keiley

customer_reviews.title: We first used these Binoculars on Safari in Tanzania. ...
customer_reviews.text: We first used these Binoculars on Safari in Tanzania. They far exceeded our expectations and helped make our visit remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Tyler

customer_reviews.title: super wide field view with clear image
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction, super wide field view with clear image.
customer_reviews.author: bz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Casual Birdwatcher
customer_reviews.text: I have recently become an avid bird watcher and I was using a cheap old pair that I inherited from my father. I purchased these after reading the reviews online, and I am so glad I did. They are so much better than my old pair. For the price, I highly recommend this product. They are easy to operate, they provide a clear view, and they are very sturdy. I have used them on two birding trips and three other people ended up purchasing them after trying my pair!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Good viewing and steady!
customer_reviews.text: Very good viewing. I bought these for Safari in Africa, and they worked well. I wish they were lighter in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Carmella Barbash

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...
customer_reviews.text: This is a secind pair of Celestron binoculars for my family. I carry the 8x42 Granite and love the quick and accurate focus, the solid diopter adjust and the spin out and snap in place eye cups. Oh, did I mention the clarity and light gather capability of them? Solid bright image all the way to the edges of the feild of view. Stunning. Even in bad conditions. But I was supposed to be reveiwing the 10x42's...well that's easy. Ditto, plus the additional magnification. If you can hold 'em steady, you'll love them.
customer_reviews.author: Brett N

customer_reviews.title: The built is sturdy. On the heavy side
customer_reviews.text: Plastic/Rubber eye pice has come off after a few use. It wasn't glued on there properly or not enough glue was used.So now I have to squeeze in the eye piece to turn it so it does not slip. The built is sturdy. On the heavy side. It is expected. Optics is not bad compare to the 'toy' binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T.

customer_reviews.title: better
customer_reviews.text: These are simply by far the best binoculars I've ever owned, and I've owned many. As someone said looking through them at a college football game this weekend "they are so clear they are almost 3-D"!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dandy

customer_reviews.title: Expected more
customer_reviews.text: I like Celestron binoculars. Have viewed three different models; Nature DX (8x32), Trailseeker (10x32), and the Granite Series (7x33). Of the three I really settled on the Trailseeker, but to be honest the Nature DX was a close second, with a bit less contrast. The Granite had a very bright picture and a bit larger sweet spot than the either of the others but I couldn't get past the cloudy (misty) ring on the very outer edge. I wanted to like these binoculars but could not get past the visual ring. Perhaps this was a defect with just this one binocular, who knows. The ergonomics are wonderful for my hands and I found focus and contrast excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding!
customer_reviews.text: It's waterproof, relatively lightweight, and with a wide field of view. Can't beat the price for a binocular this good.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof Very bright, light weight. The shoulder harness is much more comfortable than a neck strap. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide field of view required and smalle damaged case received
customer_reviews.text: The small cast came with a zipper that fell apart in my hand. Wher shell we send the case for a replacement? When I found these binoculars on your web sight, they were shone as wide field of view. The box says 3040 ft. At 1000yards. That is not wide field of view. What Celestron binoculars are wide field of view?
customer_reviews.author: JERRY E MINNEAR

product_meta.title: Celestron 71372 10x42 Granite Binocular (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:10 x 42| Configuration:BinocularBEDROCK OF THE SERIOUS OBSERVER’S TOOLKIT - Celestron Granite ED Series Roof Prism Binoculars represent the core values of rock solid binocular design, ultra-high performance glass and reliable construction at an affordable price. The ED lenses ensure that each wavelength of light is kept in balance with all the others to provide an image which is true-to-life. They are also useful in lowlight situations helping you to pick out details in subjects in dense brush even at dawn and dusk. They stand up well against the much more expensive European and higher end Japanese manufactured binoculars at a fraction of their cost - a real value! EXTRA LOW DISPERSION GLASS - Granite Binoculars feature ED (Extra-Low Dispersion) glass, delivering edge-to-edge sharpness with excellent color correction and razor sharp images while virtually eliminating chromatic aberration. Coupled with fully broadband multi-coatings the optical design delivers crisp, high contrast images with accurate color reproduction for unrivaled image quality superior to standard optical glass. FULLY MULTI-COATED OPTICS AND BAK-4 PRISMS - The Phase Coated Prisms correct out-of-phase shifts of light rays to ensure maximum contrast while providing superb natural color fidelity and vivid color saturation. High grade BaK-4 prism glass renders sharp images and the reflectivity coatings increases the throughput transmission to provide bright images that are rich in detail. LIGHTWEIGHT, WATERPROOF CONSTRUCTION - State-of-the-art modern open frame style provides an excellent grip and is comfortable to handle (even single handed) with the reduced weight. The body is made of magnesium alloy which is lighter than aluminum, and more rugged and tough for handling in any environment. They are a mid-sized binocular, perfect for travel because of their weight and small form factor yet are packed with features that match up well optically, mechanically and ergonomically with binoculars costing two to five times as much. Metal Twist Up Eyecups: More durable and a longer life than plastic eyecups. Less susceptible to breaking. Twist-up eyecup for correct positioning of the users eyes for comfortable viewing with or without eyeglasses. Waterproof construction provides peace of mind when unexpected weather rolls in. The housing is also filled with dry nitrogen gas to prevent the internal lenses from fogging when moving between extreme temperatures or when using the binocular in damp conditions. PERFECT FOR: Bird Watching, Hunting, Wildlife and Nature Viewing, Travel and Outdoors, Sporting Events, Astronomical Viewing, Low Light; Extended Use; Changing Weather Conditions

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Granite 10x42 Binocular (item #71372) 

GRANITE 10X42 BINOCULAR

Item #71372  * Overview
 * Details
 * Specs

OVERVIEW
Granite 10x42 - General Features  * Fully Multi-Coatings - provide maximum light transmission with the highest levels of contrast. Provide superb natural color fidelity and vivid color saturation
 * BaK-4 Prisms with High Reflectivity Coatings - the high grade prisms allow for sharp images and the reflectivity coatings increases the throughput transmission to provide the brightest possible images
 * Phase Coated Prisms - correct out-of-phase shifts of light rays to ensure maximum contrast
 * Waterproof and Fogproof - nitrogen purged
 *  - lead and arsenic free
 * Focus Knob, Diopter Ring and Twist-Up Eyecups - made of metal for long life and precision movement
 * Binocular Harness Strap - takes the strain off of your neck and distributes the weight load of the binoculars to your shoulders and torso. The harness is very comforable and keeps the binoculars handy when carrying them during extended use
 * Standard Deluxe Binocular Strap
 * Carrying Case
 * No Fault Lifetime Warranty

DETAILS
Pinnacle of Optical Design

 Celestron Granite Series Roof Prism Binoculars are the pinnacle of optical and mechanical design. They stand up well against the much more expensive European and higher end Japanese manufactured binoculars at a fraction of their cost - a real value! 

 Granite Binoculars feature ED glass in the optical design. They deliver edge-to-edge sharpness with excellent color correction and razor sharp images while virtually eliminating chromatic aberration. 

 State-of-the-art modern open frame style provides an excellent grip and is comfortable to handle (even single handed) with the reduced weight. 

 The body is made of magnesium which is much lighter than aluminum and more rugged and tough for handling in any environment. 

 Perfect for: 

 * Hunting 
 * Bird Watching 
 * Sporting Events 
 * Wildlife and Nature Viewing 
 * Travel and Outdoors 
 * Astronomical Viewing 

SPECS
 * Optical Design: Roof Prizm 
 * Diameter: 42 mm (1.65 in)
 * Magnification: 10 x 
 * Angular Field of View: 6.5 °
